text.paragraph:
JHL FIN J528-4580-6657 Date(s): 2021-09-22 - 2021-09-25
Garcia, Morgan and Salazar 48491 Spence Terrace Apt. 258 North Debra, KY 40202- (+1-5524541545
Discharge Disposition: OP Self Care or Home

tr.td: Title: Advanced Heart Failure Clinic Consult Note
Author: Bailey, ULP - APRN - Med-Cardio-Midlevels

Patient: PARKER, Michael Daniel mrn:a440517097 fin:y5578800166
Age: 50 Years Sex: Male DOB: 1970-12-03
Seen in Advanced Heart Failure Clinic for follow up

50 year old male with phx:
ICM
--Echo 11-2020: LVEF 29%, LVDD 6.4, mild RVE with mild RV hypokinesis, mild MR/TR
--Echo 10-2019: LVEF 26%, LVDD 5.96, G3DD, mild MR
--Echo 4-2019: LVEF 10%, LVDD 6.18, no thrombus, mild MR/TR
--Echo 11-2018 @ UofL: LVEF 13%
--Echo 10-2018: LVEF 25%, LVDD 6.6, mild MR/PR
--Echo 3-2017: LVEF 39%, LVDD 5.8, mild MR
--Echo 8-2015: LVEF 30-35%, LVDD 6.00, mild MR
ICD (St. Jude)
--Prior VF arrest
CAD
--LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
--s/p MI and PCI to RCA around 2014
HTN
T2DM
COPD
OSA
CKD, stage III
Persistent Afib
Obesity, class II
Pulm HTN
Depression
Liver fibrosis
--mild per Biopsy 1-2021
He was last seen while admitted 12/31/ through 2021-09-08 with ADHF. He presented after feeling generally unwell, SOA, and having subjective fever and cough. No objective fever on presentation to ER, however having an elevated WBC to 16K, AKI on CKD Cr 3 (baseline ~2), and hyperkalemia 6.3.
No CP. Troponin 0.08. Covid nasopharyngeal swab negative. CT chest not concerning for covid-19. He was admitted and treated for Sepsis (2/2 PICC, line +stenotrophomonas maltophila), also incidentally found Cirrhosis on imaging. Liver c/s and Liver Biopsy shows minimal fibrosis with no evidence of cirrhosis. Discharged home on milrinone.
Today he states he is at baseline for him. He can perform his ADL's with no SOA but has ongoing low energy levels and SOA with moderate exertion. He denies any LE swelling/abdominal distention or weight gain since his discharge. States he is adhering to his dietary restrictions as recommended. He does report he is having trouble sleeping and asking for a sleep aide. In addition he reports frequent leg cramping and restlessness especially at night. He denies PND/Orthopnea/CP/Palpitations/N/V/syncope/bleeding/falls. No fevers/rigors/chills/sick contacts/diarrhea/constipation/urinary symptoms/tremors/visual or auditory disturbances/balance issues/aches or pain in the joints or muscle.
Ten systems were reviewed and were negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.

Wt: 239.4 pounds compared to 232 pounds last visit
HR: 80
RR: 20
BP: 124/80
Temp: 98.1 F
BMI: 36.3
Gen: Well built obese female in NAD
HEENT: PER and no palor or icterus and mmm
NECK: JVD - and no carotid bruits
CARDS: S1 S2 heard and no m/r/g. RRR
LUNGS: b/l BS present without any wheeze or crackles
ABD: soft NT and normal BS
EXT: warm and no LE edema, RUE PICC c/d/i
NEURO: AAO x 3 and no FND
PSYCH: normal mood and affect

50 year old male with phx:
ICM
--Echo 11-2020: LVEF 29%, LVDD 6.4, mild RVE with mild RV hypokinesis, mild MR/TR
--Echo 10-2019: LVEF 26%, LVDD 5.96, G3DD, mild MR
--Echo 4-2019: LVEF 10%, LVDD 6.18, no thrombus, mild MR/TR
--Echo 11-2018 @ UofL: LVEF 13%
--Echo 10-2018: LVEF 25%, LVDD 6.6, mild MR/PR
--Echo 3-2017: LVEF 39%, LVDD 5.8, mild MR
--Echo 8-2015: LVEF 30-35%, LVDD 6.00, mild MR
ICD (St. Jude)
--Prior VF arrest
CAD
--LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
--s/p MI and PCI to RCA around 2014
HTN
T2DM
COPD
OSA
CKD, stage III
Persistent Afib
Obesity, class II
Pulm HTN
Depression
Liver fibrosis
--mild per Biopsy 1-2021
1. Chronic HFrEF with low cardiac output on home Inotrope therapy
ICM
--Echo 11-2020: LVEF 29%, LVDD 6.4, mild RVE with mild RV hypokinesis, mild MR/TR
--Echo 10-2019: LVEF 26%, LVDD 5.96, G3DD, mild MR
--Echo 4-2019: LVEF 10%, LVDD 6.18, no thrombus, mild MR/TR
--Echo 8-2015: LVEF 30-35%, LVDD 6.00, mild MR
ICD (St. Jude): no shocks
Stage D
Currently NYHA Class III symptoms on home inotrope
compensated
optivolemic
--RHC 2021-07-05 (Without any home afterload medications): RA 8/11, 7; RV 54/0, 5; PA 45/23, 30; PCW 24; TPG 6; CO/CI 4.7/2.1
RHC 2020-07-15: RA 8, 59/2 (8), PA 55/26 (38), PCW 28, TPG 10, PVR 2.2; Fick CO/CI 4.5/2.1, Thermal CO/CI 2.9/1.4
CPET 2020-07-15: MVO2 13, RER 1.14
Inotrope: milrinone @ 0.375 mcg/kg/min>>Picc placed 1-2021
Diuretic: Bumex 3mg po tid & metolazone 2.5mg Tues, Thurs, Sat. Labs weekly per home health.
BB: Toprol XL 25 mg po qd
ACE/ARB: none due to CKD
Ald Antag: spironolactone 50mg po qd
H/N: Hydralazine 100 mg po tid. Imdur 30 mg po qd.
SGLT2 inhibitor: Farxiga 10 mg po qd to help prevent HF hospitalizations (started at discharge but has not received yet). Watch GFR closely.
Advanced HF Therapies:
He is not a candidate for OHTx due to uncontrolled diabetes and BMI >35. He was evaluated for LVAD. Dr. Dunbar, LVAD coordinator, and Social Worker met with him and his brother and planned for LVAD after brother recovers from foot surgery (had in January) so he can be available as social support. Today he states his brother is mobile with crutches and should be able to offer adequate support in next 4-6 weeks. Discussed with Dr. Dunbar and we will discuss VAD implant timeline at MDT meeting this week.
2. CAD
--s/p PCI to RCA 2014
--LHC 3-2019: LM/LAD/LCX patent arteries and patent prox RCA stent
no angina
continue statin, ASA, and BB
3. Persistent Afib
continue BB and Xarelto
4. CKD, stage III
labs weekly per home health to be tomorrow
5. Obesity, class II with comorbidities
BMI 36.3
encouraged to work on weight loss through healthy eating and calorie reduction
encouraged to increase activity
educated on the importance of maintaining BMI <35 in order to qualify for OHTx in future
7. OSA, untreated
states he sleeps well without cpap machine
reeducated on OSA and treatments
8. HTN
controlled
continue meds as above
10. Depression
follows with psyche
11. Chronic leg pain at night
--c/o muscle spasms especially in legs keeping him awake at night and difficultly sleeping
recently started on duloxetine 40 mg po qd per PCP
recommend f/u with PCP regarding RLS
add hydroxyzine prn at HS for insomnia
Recommendations:
1. hydroxyzine 50 mg po q hs prn sleep
2. follow up with PCP regarding insomnia and restless legs
3. call with worsening HF symptoms
4. Follow up in Advanced Heart Failure clinic in 6 weeks/sooner PRN

Ongoing
CHF (congestive heart failure)
COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease)
Diabetes
HTN (hypertension)
MI (myocardial infarction)

EXCISION OF LIVER, PERCUTANEOUS APPROACH, DIAGNOSTIC (2021-09-06), REMOVAL OF INFUSION DEV FROM GREAT VESSEL, EXTERN APPROACH (2021-09-02), MEASURE OF CARDIAC SAMPL & PRESSURE, R HEART, PERC APPROACH (2021-07-05), Defibrillator, device, Stented coronary artery.

Home Medications (21) Active

No Known Medication Allergies

Alcohol
Alcohol Use History No.
Alcohol Use History No.

Tobacco
Smoking Status Never smoker.
No changes since last visit
Follows with PCP
weekly per home health: due tomorrow
Addendum by Bailey, ULP - APRN - Med-Cardio-Midlevels on 2021-09-25 15:03:10 EST

12. T2DM on insulin
continue insulin and Farxiga with management per primary
